name: 吳和庭
objective: １.電腦網路概述與網路階層結構２.路由與交換技術與協定 ３.錯誤、流量與擁塞控制 ４.媒體存取控制 ５.區域網路技術與應用６.網際網路協定與標準７.網路互連技術８.網路機制效能評估
schedule:
Course Webpage: http://www.ntut.edu.tw/~htwu/courses/Fall2013CN/Fall2013CN.htm

Week 1: Introduction; Internet Architecture
Week 2: Protocol Layer and Their Service Models
Week 3: Application Layer: Principles; Web and HTTP; E-mail System
Week 4: Application Layer: DNS; P2P Application; Socket Programming
Week 5: Transport Layer: Principles; MUX and DeMUX; UDP
Week 6: Transport Layer: Reliable Transport; TCP; Congestion Control
Week 7: TCP Congestion Control; Midterm #1
Week 8: The Network Layer: Principles; Router Architecture
Week 9: The Network Layer: IP; Routing Algorithms; Internet Routing
Week 10: Link Layer: Principles; Media Access Control Protocols
Week 11: Local Area Networks: Ethernet; Link-Layer Switching
Week 12: Wireless Networks: IEEE 802.11 LANs and Beyond
Week 13: Midterm #2; Principles of Cellular Networks
Week 14: Mobility Management; Mobile IP; Handover Issues
Week 15: Multimedia Networks: Architectures; Multimedia Streams
Week 16: Protocols of Multimedia Protocols; Class of Service
Week 17: Selected Topics on Computer Networks
Week 18: Final Exam.
scorePolicy:
Grading Bases:
1.　　Homeworks (A few)                  25%
2.　　Two Mid Terms                      50%
3.　　Final Exam.                        25%
materials:
Prerequisites:  Basic Programming Skills, Computer and Network Concepts
Textbook: Kurose and Ross, “Computer Networking: A Top-down Approach”, 6th ed.,Pearson, 2013.

Reference books:
1.  　　Comer, “Computer Network and Internets”, 5th ed., Pearson, 2008.
2.　　Forouzan, “Data Communications and Networking”, 5th ed.,Mcgraw-Hill, 2012.
3.　　Stallings, “Data and Computer Communications”, 9th ed., Prentice-Hall, 2010.
4.　　Tanenbaum and Wetherall, “Computer Networks”, 5th ed. Pearson, 2010.
5.　　Peterson and Davie, “Computer Networks: A Systems Approach”, 5th ed., Morgan Kaufmann, 2011.
